description: Tesla, the electric vehicle manufacturer led by Elon Musk, has introduced a distinctive cat bed in China that draws inspiration from the design of the company's forthcoming electric pickup truck, the Cybertruck. The 'Cybertruck Multifunctional Corrugated Cat Nest' is crafted from angular cardboard and features an angular shape reminiscent of the Cybertruck's unique aesthetic.

heading: WhatsApp introduces screen-sharing feature for video calls
description: WhatsApp, the messaging platform owned by Meta, has introduced a new screen-sharing feature aimed at enhancing its video calling capabilities. The addition puts WhatsApp in competition with established video conferencing apps like Microsoft Meet, Google Meet, Zoom, and Apple's FaceTime.

heading: Brac University team ranks second at RoboSub 2023
description: BRACU Duburi, a team from Brac University, has secured the second overall position in RoboSub 2023, an international student competition hosted by the nonprofit organisation RoboNation. In addition to becoming the first runners-up, the Bangladeshi team also received an Ingenuity Special Award in this competition.

heading: Lenovo partners with Islami Bank for tech development
description: Lenovo, a multinational technology company, has partnered with Islami Bank, a local commercial bank, to provide 1,500 units of ThinkCentre Neo 50T laptops. The collaboration is a part of the two company's steps towards technological development, with Lenovo providing the bank with continuous technical support whenever required.

heading: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip5 and Galaxy Z Fold5: pre-orders started
description: Samsung Bangladesh has started accepting pre-orders for its fifth-generation foldables – Galaxy Z Flip5 and Galaxy Z Fold5.

heading: Saudi Arabia invests heavily in gaming to propel diversification
description: Saudi Arabia has made a resolute commitment to invest $8 billion in the gaming industry over the past year, with ambitious plans to become an international gaming hub.

heading: Country in risk of targeted cyber attack on August 15, says CIRT
description: According to a press release issued by the Bangladesh Government's Computer Incident Response Team (BGD e-GOV CIRT) and signed by CIRT Project Director Engr. Mohammad Saiful Alam Khan, the country is facing an imminent cyber threat on August 15. The alert was issued in response to a declaration made by religious and ideologically motivated underground hacker groups. These groups have threatened to launch a series of cyber-attacks against Bangladesh's cyberspace on the specified date, as stated in the press release by BGD e-Gov CIRT.

heading: The Land Cruiser 70 returns
description: The iconic Toyota Land Cruiser 70 series, known for its rugged reliability and unyielding performance, is making a triumphant return with its first update in 15 years. While North American fans are still unable to purchase it for road use, the new 2024 model is back on sale in Japan.

heading: YouTube Premium launched in Bangladesh at BDT 239 per month
description: YouTube Premium and YouTube Music are now officially available in Bangladesh, at a cost of BDT 239 per month for the premium subscription.

heading: Facebook page scam: Hackers target Bangladeshi pages, agencies
description: Unscrupulous hackers are employing deceptive tactics to lure users into downloading tools such as Facebook Ad Manager and Google Bard, subsequently infecting their devices with harmful malware.

heading: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5 and Z Fold 5: Our first impressions
description: Samsung has taken the spotlight once again with the unveiling of its latest offerings: the Galaxy Z Flip 5 and Galaxy Z Fold 5.

heading: TikTok launches new text-only post feature
description: Global entertainment platform TikTok has recently introduced a ‘text-only’ Post feature as a new format to its platform.

heading: RUET team ranks 8th in Formula Student Switzerland
description: Team Crack Platoon from Rajshahi University of Engineering & Technology (RUET) has ranked 8th overall at Formula Student Switzerland earlier this month, participating against 22 teams from 12 countries. They also clinched the 4th position in the ‘business plan presentation’ category at the competition.

heading: Bangladesh Startup Summit Day 2: Jaan Tallinn, Skype Co-Founder, on Artificial Intelligence
description: In a riveting fireside chat during the second day of the Bangladesh Startup Summit, attendees were treated to an exclusive virtual conversation with Jaan Tallinn, the co-founder of Skype and a thought leader in the field of artificial intelligence (AI).

heading: Bangladesh ripe ground for startup investments, discuss panellists
description: On the second day of the Bangladesh Startup Summit, a panel of distinguished experts convened to discuss the question, "Why Invest in Bangladesh?" The session aimed to highlight the country's appeal as an investment destination and explore the various opportunities it offers.

heading: Carving a place for Bangladesh in Reddit's r/place
description: United by a shared purpose, the r/bangladesh community gathered on a Discord server, starting with just a handful of individuals and growing to an astonishing 3500 members.

heading: Team from Bangladesh ranks 2nd at Robotics World Cup 2023
description: This year's World Robotics Championship was organised across nine tracks, including the ‘WRC Innovation Contest’, in which Team Atlas became the first runners-up. Team Atlas brought two robots; Defender, a firefighting robot, and Atlas Spark, a multifunctional robot used for mining, investigation, and rescue.

heading: Every end marks a new beginning
description: To our readers, thank you for your unwavering support and loyalty. We invite you to join us in embracing this new beginning and be a part of the exciting journey that lies ahead. Together, let us explore the endless possibilities that technology and startups offer, celebrating the innovative spirit that drives us all.

heading: Is Starlink coming to Bangladesh?
description: As per latest reports, SpaceX officials have come to Dhaka to strike a deal with Bangladesh's ICT Division in officially launching Starlink internet connection in the country. With official talks now underway, we may be on the path to having Starlink internet for our own homes.

heading: How to save your smartphone from hackers
description: Smartphones have become an indispensable companion in our daily lives. Therefore, it is important to prioritise its security. Let's learn how to protect your smartphone from hacking.

heading: How to identify real and fake iPhones
description: iPhones have a universal appeal, and many people dream of owning one, regardless of their profession.

heading: How Twitter's logo changed over the years
description: As we say goodbye to the blue bird that we have all known and loved, let's take a look at how Twitter's logo and icon have changed over the years.

heading: Twitter's blue bird logo to be replaced by an X: Elon Musk
description: Elon Musk recently signalled that he would do more to take Twitter in a new direction with a rebranding that will replace its well-known blue bird logo with an X after acknowledging advertisers have been slow to return.

heading: Lewis Hamilton breaks record in Formula One racing
description: Lewis Hamilton, a British-born Formula One driver representing Mercedes, has recently broken the record for obtaining the most poles in a single circuit.

heading: ChatGPT's Android app coming next week
description: Users can now pre-register for the ChatGPT Android app on Google Play Store, with the official release slated to be next week.

heading: The rise of AI in Hollywood: Actors and writers vs automation
description: Recently, Hollywood has been having its fair share of internal conflict due to AI, as SAG-AFTRA and WGA are on strike against AMPTP, primarily regarding the trade association’s recent stance on AI.

heading: Safeguarding workspaces from escalating cyber attacks: A comprehensive guide
description: This article provides a comprehensive guide on how organisations can safeguard their data, secure their employees' information, prevent cyber attacks, and respond effectively in case of a breach.

heading: Google is developing an AI that can write news stories
description: Google is reportedly developing an AI tool under the working title 'Genesis' that aims to generate news stories when supplied with event details.

heading: TikTok removed over 42 lakh videos in Bangladesh during Q1 2023
description: 92.2% of the violative videos in Bangladesh were removed before anyone could view them.

heading: AI news presenters: What they mean for the future of newsroom
description: Since the debut of the country's first-ever artificial intelligence news presenter named 'Aparajita', there has been a raging debate regarding whether AI news presenters will take over the job of human news presenters in Bangladesh.

heading: Apple testing 'Apple GPT' to rival ChatGPT: reports
description: Apple is currently testing a new AI tool to compete with OpenAI, as per a recent report by Bloomberg News. While there has been no definitive announcement regarding the AI tool yet, insider reports are currently calling it 'Apple GPT'.

heading: Channel 24 introduces country's first 'AI' news presenter
description: Channel 24, a private TV network based in Dhaka, today unveiled the country's first-ever 'artificial intelligence' news presenter named 'Aparajita.' Aparajita debuted during the 7 pm bulletin on Wednesday. Channel 24 did not disclose the details behind the technology used in making the 'artificial intelligence' presenter.

heading: How Nolan detonated an 'atomic bomb' for Oppenheimer without CGI
description: ppenheimer. Nolan, known for his commitment to realism, achieved the explosive effect of a detonating atomic bomb without relying on computer-generated imagery (CGI). Instead, he employed a combination of practical effects and innovative techniques to create a truly immersive experience for the audience.

heading: iPhone 16 Pro Max may get a huge upgrade: A super telephoto camera
description: In a recent report originating from reliable Apple news source MacRumors, it has been suggested that the highly anticipated iPhone 16 Pro Max could revolutionise smartphone photography with the inclusion of a super telephoto periscope camera.

heading: TikTok wants to beat Spotify; rolls out music streaming in more countries
description: TikTok has recently launched its music streaming platform, TikTok Music, in certain countries. The subscription-based app is currently available in Indonesia, Brazil, and select beta testers from Australia, Mexico, and Singapore.

heading: SophosEncrypt ransomware impersonates cybersecurity firm Sophos
description: A new ransomware-as-a-service called SophosEncrypt is impersonating cybersecurity giant Sophos, using the company name for its malicious activities.

heading: Shark Tank India investors funded only 27 startups; they promised 65
description: In a recent analysis by market intelligence firm PrivateCircle, it has been revealed that the investors on "Shark Tank India" failed to fulfill a significant portion of their investment promises made during the show's inaugural season. The report highlights concerns over the show's credibility and raises questions about the efficacy of the investors' commitments.

heading: Twitter faces lawsuit over severance pay of former employees
description: Twitter was recently sued for owing around $500 million in severance pay to former employees, as per a proposed class action lawsuit filed by former Twitter senior engineer Chris Woodfield.

heading: Microsoft patches 132 security vulnerabilities in latest Windows update
description: Microsoft has recently patched a total of 132 security flaws in the latest Windows update. Out of them, nine were rated 'critical' and 121 were rated 'important' in terms of their severity when the patch was first released.

heading: Russia bans iPhone for govt. employees
description: Russian officials have been instructed to cease using iPhones for official purposes. The ban, which took effect on July 17, has been enforced by the country's trade ministry, with other ministries and state-owned enterprises expected to follow suit.

heading: United Nations to hold first ever meeting on AI regulation
description: The United Nations Security Council is set to convene its first-ever formal discussion on the subject of artificial intelligence (AI) this week in New York. With the British presidency of the Security Council in July, the nation is taking the opportunity to rally international support for addressing the potential risks posed by emerging AI technology.

heading: 5 books every startup founder should read
description: We present five indispensable books that every startup founder should read. These literary gems offer profound wisdom, practical advice, and valuable perspectives from seasoned entrepreneurs, business leaders, and thought-provoking thinkers.

heading: What happens when our data gets leaked: Here's how concerned you should be
description: A recent security breach on the website of the Office of the Registrar General, Birth & Death Registration (BDRIS) has raised significant concerns regarding data privacy and the potential consequences individuals may face when their sensitive information falls into the wrong hands. Let's will delve into the implications of such a breach, highlighting the far-reaching effects on affected individuals.

heading: You can now use Google Bard in Bangla
description: Google has released a new update to Bard, in which the AI chatbot can understand and give replies in over 40 languages, including Bangla.

heading: Bytes is now Tech & Startup
description: In a world driven by technological advancement, there are few endeavours as inspiring as those dedicated to unravelling the complexities of the digital realm. Today, we pay homage to one such endeavour, one that has shaped the landscape of technology journalism in Bangladesh over the past decade. With heavy hearts, we bid farewell to Bytes, a publication that has been a beacon of knowledge, insight, and innovation since its inception in 2013.
